title: crash when creating path from formated string

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust fn main() { let a = std::path::Path::from(format!("a/b")); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120 commit-date: 2022-11-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.65.0 LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/context.rs:703:13: node_type: no type for node `expr { let res = $crate::fmt::format($crate::__export::format_args!($($arg)*)); res } (hir_id=HirId { owner: DefId(0:376 ~ git_repos[163e]::repo::init_repos), local_id: 118 })` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1462:9 ```
Backtrace
